column4: Hey, guys! My laptop battery got depleted and my PC shutdown instantly... and now my ubuntu 8.10 doesn't find any boot records... I got some error msg and "grub >" command line
sounds like grub got fried, you can remap it from a live cd, see this thread: http://maketecheasier.com/how-to-restore-grub-in-ubuntu/2008/04/11
did you see my post above?
I don't have grub problems, grub is all that starts
and I don't have usb flashdrive
does it give an error? and do you have a cd drive and live cd?
error is smthn like "Couldn't find boot blah-blah..." don't have rescue disk
the blah blah blah part would help :)
I have to reboot, write it down on a piece of paper, reboot and type it down in order to get the blah-blah to your screen...
I'll do it, so wait up! :)
http://fpaste.org/paste/2317 - the blah blah part
- the more accurate ver: http://fpaste.org/paste/2318
from what i can tell the kernal is not initializing
considering my ubuntu is installed "Inside Windows" is a throuh-windows repair possible, or editing what must be eddited or... ?
oh u used wubi eh, unfortunately ive never used it, so someone else should prob help
i think it can prob be repaired form withen windows, does the wubi installer offer any repair options?
nope, just new installation... I wonder what will happen if I install it again, replacing the old installation...
that will work, just dlete it and install to the same space
I will loose everything installed within, right? :D
anything important there?  may have a solution
couldn't say so... I installed it like... 10 days ago, but the updates take forever...
maybe I will... I'll try using help at my country's servers... hope theres s.o. whos got the problem
ok goodluck, im going to try to sleep again :)
